output.conclusion: By completing this course, you will have a solid foundation in computer vision, enabling you to tackle real-world problems and build innovative applications.
output.introduction: Welcome to Intermediate Computer Vision! This course builds upon your existing knowledge of image processing and machine learning to delve deeper into the fascinating world of computer vision. We will explore advanced techniques for image understanding, object detection, and scene analysis.

chapters.description: Review of camera geometry, intrinsic and extrinsic parameters, and different camera models (pinhole, perspective).
Homographies, affine transformations, and projective transformations. Applications in image warping and alignment.
Epipolar geometry, stereo correspondence, and depth estimation from stereo images.
In-depth analysis of SIFT, SURF, and ORB. Understanding their strengths and weaknesses.
Techniques for robust feature matching, including RANSAC and other outlier rejection methods.
Applying feature detection and matching to create seamless panoramas from multiple images.
Introduction to object detection frameworks like YOLO, SSD, and Faster R-CNN.
Understanding how region proposal networks (RPNs) work in object detection pipelines.
Techniques for filtering redundant bounding box detections.
Pixel-level image classification using deep learning techniques.
Architecture and training of fully convolutional networks for semantic segmentation.
Understanding the U-Net architecture and its applications in medical image segmentation.
Techniques for estimating motion between consecutive frames in a video.
Applying optical flow to stabilize shaky video footage.
Introduction to action recognition in videos using deep learning.
